entry.title: AltDrag - 1.0 beta 2
entry.content: Released 1.0 beta 2. I've also launched a crowdfunding campaign for version 1.0. Please go to the website to read more.

entry.title: AltDrag - 1.0 beta 1
entry.content:
Released 1.0 beta. The biggest new feature is a configuration GUI. Finally, AltDrag no longer requires you to know what an ini file is to be able to configure it. There are some other new features, performance improvements and bug fixes too, see the changelog below for more information. This beta is only available as a 7z archive.

This release also features a new language; Chinese translated by Jack Jin. The new configuration GUI is not yet available in Spanish or Galician since their translations have not been submitted yet. If you are looking to translate AltDrag, read this page.

Changelog:

  • Added configuration GUI.
  • Added ability to scroll through windows with the scrollwheel (like Alt+Tab!).
  • Added ability to blacklist by process name (see wiki).
  • Added new mouse action: Lower.
  • Added performance options MoveRate and ResizeRate. Increase if dragging or resizing is slow.
  • The scroll hook should no longer stop working when locking the screen or resuming the computer from sleep. A timer checks every 5 seconds if the scroll hook is still working, and re-enables it if it is not.
  • You can now press Escape to stop AltDrag. Useful if AltDrag gets in a weird state.
  • You can now press Ctrl to make AltDrag think the mouse cursor is still inside the current monitor. Should help people who have multiple monitors and want to snap at borders between monitors.
  • Removed info.txt. Use the website for help.
Visit the website
Download the beta
Discuss in the forum (no registration required)
Visit the author's website
Donate (show your appreciation, any amount will do)

entry.title: AltDrag - 0.9
entry.content:
Released 0.9. The new version adds a couple of very nice features. Among them are an option to mimic Aero Snap in Windows 7. This will work even if you run Windows XP or Vista. I've also added an option to automatically focus windows when you start dragging them. Another option I've added allows you to use the scroll wheel on windows that do not have keyboard focus. There are a few more new features and a few bug fixes, read all the details in the changelog below.

With this version I have taken extra care to deliver a beta test period to eliminate bugs. I believe this version is the best one so far and delivers a lot of new functionality. I have already begun planning some new features for the next version.

I hope you recognize the work, effort and time that I have put on AltDrag and take a few minutes to think about donating money. I don't ask for much, any amount will do. Remember that AltDrag will always be free and open source no matter what.

Changelog:

  • Added Aero option. Alt-drag windows to the left, right and top side of the screen. Corners work too!
  • Added AutoFocus and AutoRemaximize options.
  • Added InactiveScroll. Enable it to scroll inactive windows.
  • Added new mouse actions: AlwaysOnTop and Close.
  • It is now possible to toggle the maximized state with a resize button while dragging.
  • Replaced roll-up behavior with Aero behavior.
  • Renamed "stick" to "snap" as people seem to "get" that term better.
  • Fixed some bugs that prevented HookWindows from working properly.
  • Tweaked the blacklist (see wiki).
Visit the website
Download installer - Archive: English - Spanish - Galician
Discuss in the forum (no registration required)
Visit the author's website

entry.title: AltDrag - 0.9 release candidate 1
entry.content:
Released 0.9 release candidate. This update fixes a number of bugs that were present in the beta, including one major bug if you had the taskbar oriented at a non-default location. It also adds a new feature that allows you to use the mouse wheel to scroll inactive windows. You can enable it by setting InactiveScroll=1 in the settings. For a complete list of changes, see the changelog below. The release candidate is only available as a 7z archive.

I want those of you who have multiple monitors to see if there are any issues. Try obscure configurations. I only own one monitor myself so you can understand that I have troubles testing multi-monitor setups.

Changelog:

  • Added InactiveScroll. Enable it to scroll inactive windows.
  • Fixed major bug with custom taskbar locations (bug only present in the beta).
  • Expanded Aero option.
  • Expanded AutoRemaximized option.
  • It is now possible to toggle the maximized state with a resize button while dragging.
Visit the website
Download the release candidate
Discuss in the forum (no registration required)
Visit the author's website

entry.title: How to compile my programs
entry.content:
I have made a video explaining how to compile SuperF4. This might be of interest if you are learning programming and want to make your own modifications to SuperF4. The instructions also work just as well with my other programs. Go to the Build wiki page to see it. P.S. I bet all of you have noticed the Xmas tray icon. It will expire in January, but you can keep it by setting Xmas=1 in the ini file. :)

Visit the website
Watch the video on YouTube
Discuss in the forum (no registration required)
Visit the author's website

entry.title: AltDrag - 0.9 beta 1
entry.content:
Released 0.9 beta. The biggest new feature is that AltDrag now can mimic the Aero Snap effect in Windows 7. This even works with Windows XP and should work perfectly with multiple monitors! For a complete list of changes, see the changelog below. I expect to release a proper version in January. In any case, I believe that this is the best version of AltDrag yet! The beta is only available as a 7z archive. Please report any bugs that you find!!

Changelog:

  • Added Aero option. Alt-drag windows to the left, right and top side of the screen. Corners work too!
  • Added new mouse actions: AlwaysOnTop and Close.
  • Replaced roll-up behavior with Aero behavior. Double-click with middle/right mouse button.
  • Renamed "stick" to "snap" as people seem to "get" that term better.
  • Fixed some bugs that prevented HookWindows from working properly.
  • Tweaked the blacklist (see wiki).
Visit the website
Download the beta
Discuss in the forum (no registration required)
Visit the author's website

entry.title: ShutdownGuard - 1.0
entry.content:
Released 1.0. In this version I have removed PatchApps. It has now been separated to a new program. The release also fixes a couple of minor bugs and is also available in 64-bit. The installer will automatically install the correct executable. I decided to bump the version number to 1.0 since I consider ShutdownGuard feature complete. For more details, see the changelog below.

Changelog:

  • Added 64-bit executable. The installer will automatically install the correct executable.
  • Removed PatchApps. It has now been separated to a separate program. Read the wiki for more information.
  • Fixed some minor bugs.
Visit the website

entry.title: SuperF4 - 1.2
entry.content:
Released 1.2.
This update mainly brings support to StarCraft II and a few bug fixes. Another new thing is a native 64-bit executable (the installer will automatically install the correct executable). For more details, see the changelog below.

Changelog:
  • Added 64-bit executable. The installer will automatically install the correct executable.
  • Added support for alternative Ctrl+Alt+F4 detection (see SuperF4.ini). Enable this to make SuperF4 work in StarCraft II.
  • Added xkill to the tray menu (Win+F4).
  • Added manual update check to the tray menu.
  • Fixed the Shell_NotifyIcon error that appeared for some when SuperF4 was on autostart.
Visit the website
Download installer - Archive: English (x64) - Spanish (x64) - Galician (x64)
Discuss in the forum (no registration required)
Visit the author's website
